oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Development of social behaviour and importance of social relations in calves
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Niskanen, Suvi
Raussi, Satu
Veissier, Isabelle
Kaihilahti, Jutta
Hänninen, Laura
Hepola, Helena
Jauhiainen, Lauri
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Animal husbandry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We concluded that the preference for peers met at two weeks of age can be seen in proximity of the calves. However, calves can form stable relations at least until the age of 14 weeks. These relations reduce aggressive behaviour, activity and frequency of vocalization, and help calves to cope with new and potentially stressful situations.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Niskanen, Suvi; Raussi, Satu; Veissier, Isabelle; Kaihilahti, Jutta; Hänninen, Laura; Hepola, Helena and Jauhiainen, Lauri (2008) Development of social behaviour and importance of social relations in calves. In: Proceedings, International Society for Applied Ethology, p. 6.
